newsitem.title: USA: North America bunkers gain from pre-holiday buying.
newsitem.headline: North America bunkers gain from pre-holiday buying.

text.p: North American bunker prices were mostly higher from those earlier this week, with the West Coast and Houston markets enjoying good inquiries ahead of next week's Christmas holiday, traders said.
Los Angeles 380 CST was offered at $126.00 a tonne, up $5 from Tuesday, with 180 CST pegged between $127 and $129, players said.
Seattle 380 CST jumped $2 to between $125 and $127, traders said. "Singapore prices have been coming up and that's also helping us," one trader said.

Traders said Houston 380 CST also jumped $2 to offers of about $110, with 180 CST pegged at about $115. "The mid-week Christmas holiday is creting inquiries so things are inching up," one Gulf Coast player said.
Marine diesel in Houston moved $5 higher to between $219 and $225 a tonne, with traders attributing upward price pressure to a recent cold snap in the Gulf Coast.
On the East Coast, meanwhile, New York Harbor 380 CST was stable at between $117 and $120, players said, although marine diesel oil firmed $3 to offers of about $245 a tonne.
